selectedVerses.text: As through a wide breach they come; amid the crash they roll on.
The crash of your thunder was in the whirlwind; your lightnings lighted up the world; the earth trembled and shook.
"'Have you not heard that I determined it long ago? I planned from days of old what now I bring to pass, that you should make fortified cities crash into heaps of ruins,
Crash follows hard on crash; the whole land is laid waste. Suddenly my tents are laid waste, my curtains in a moment.
"On that day," declares the LORD, "a cry will be heard from the Fish Gate, a wail from the Second Quarter, a loud crash from the hills.
